verdict_rationale: Pakistan online grocery market ($350M) is below venture-scale threshold ($1B) but growing rapidly (17.5% CAGR). Karachi SAM ($350M) passes threshold. Path to $100M ARR requires 10-19% market share (CHALLENGING) with constrained unit economics (LTV/CAC 2.8-3.0). Market fragmentation (HHI 0.22) and strong growth provide opportunity, but requires exceptional execution and multi-city expansion. Data quality moderate due to Pakistan-specific gaps (58% variance).

kpis.name: TAM Size
kpis.evidence: Pakistan Online Grocery TAM $350M (2024) calculated via proxy methods: 7-10% of e-commerce ($2.8B), 30% of food delivery ($2.4B), per-capita spend adjustment. Below $1B threshold but growing at 17.5% CAGR. Regional context: Asia-Pacific $289.24B, India $48.9B quick commerce provides expansion potential.

kpis.name: SAM Size
kpis.evidence: Karachi addressable market $350M (annual), calculated top-down ($275-330M) and bottom-up ($429M) with 35% variance. Sufficient to support 3-5 competitors. 214K-267K ICP households concentrated in 4 neighborhoods (60-70% clustering).

kpis.name: Path to $100M ARR
kpis.evidence: Requires 666,667 customers at $150 ARPU. Market share: 10.5% (Karachi Year 7 with growth) or 15.9% (3-city expansion). Challenging but achievable with multi-city strategy. Comparable: Blinkit 40% India market share, Instacart 20-30% USA.

kpis.name: Unit Economics (LTV/CAC)
kpis.evidence: Base case: LTV $429 / CAC $15 = 28.6 (HEALTHY). Risk-adjusted: LTV $225 (50% churn, 2yr lifetime) / CAC $80 (competitive market) = 2.8 (CONSTRAINED at threshold). Requires retention <35% churn and CAC <$30 for sustainability. CAC payback 1.2-4 months.

kpis.name: Market Growth Rate (CAGR)
kpis.evidence: Pakistan e-commerce 17.5% CAGR (Accio 2024-2027), APAC quick commerce 19.13% CAGR, India 16.93% CAGR. Strong tailwinds: smartphone adoption (57%â†’70-80%), digital payments (JazzCash 10.7T PKR, Easypaisa 9.5T PKR), urbanization.

kpis.name: Data Source Quality
kpis.evidence: 6 TAM sources (1 Tier 1 government, 5 Tier 2 commercial), 5 benchmark sources. Variance: Pakistan TAM 58.3%, Global 76.8% (both >30% threshold). No Gartner/IDC/Forrester Pakistan coverage. Used proxy calculations with triangulation. Moderate confidence.

kpis.name: Benchmark Alignment
kpis.evidence: Pakistan ARPU $120-180 vs. India $240-300 (40% lower). Variance -40% unadjusted, but ALIGNED when adjusted for Pakistan GDP ($1,500) vs. India ($2,500). CAC $15-30 vs. India $8-15 (aligned). Churn 35% (B2C benchmark).
